clinical_study.brief_title: Improving Quality of Care for the Dying Patient in Hospice: A Quasi Experimental Trial in Liguria Region

brief_summary.textblock: This is a before-after phase II study, according to the Medical Research Council framework, investigating the feasibility of introducing the Liverpool Care Pathway for the dying patient (LCP) in 5 Ligurian hospices.

primary_outcome.time_frame: 6 months after the end of LCP implementation
primary_outcome.description: measured as proportion of hospices that complete the experimental phase of introducing the LCP Program and maintain the program in the 6 months subsequent the process of experimental LCP implementation

secondary_outcome.measure: quality of information provided to patients and to family
secondary_outcome.description: measured with the scale 1 (Informing and promoting shared decision making) from the Toolkit After-death bereaved family member interview (Teno 2001). The Toolkit will be administered to non-professional caregivers 2-4 months after the patient's death

secondary_outcome.measure: Level of advanced care planning among patients
secondary_outcome.description: measured with the scale 2 (Encouraging advance care planning) from the Toolkit After-death bereaved family member interview (Teno 2001). The Toolkit will be administered to non-professional caregivers 2-4 months after the patient's death

secondary_outcome.measure: Provision of care focusing on patient's individual needs.
secondary_outcome.description: measured with the scale 3 (Focus on individual) from the Toolkit After-death bereaved family member interview (Teno 2001). The Toolkit will be administered to non-professional caregivers 2-4 months after the patient's death

secondary_outcome.measure: Quality of emotional support to family members before an after the patient's death
secondary_outcome.description: measured with the scale 4 (Attending to the emotional and spiritual needs of the family) from the Toolkit After-death bereaved family member interview (Teno 2001). The Toolkit will be administered to non-professional caregivers 2-4 months after the patient's death

measured with the scale 5 (Providing coordination of care) from the Toolkit After-death bereaved family member interview (Teno 2001). The Toolkit will be administered to non-professional caregivers 2-4 months after the patient's death

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 2 - 4 months after the death of the patient
secondary_outcome.description: measured with the scale 6 (Supporting the self-efficacy of the family) from the Toolkit After-death bereaved family member interview (Teno 2001). The Toolkit will be administered to non-professional caregivers 2-4 months after the patient's death

secondary_outcome.measure: Appropriateness of therapeutic and diagnostic procedures
secondary_outcome.description: measured with a specific tool in which all diagnostic and therapeutic procedures and drugs administered to the patient during the last 3 days of life are reported

secondary_outcome.measure: Overall quality of care experience for patients and family
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 2 - 4 months after the death of the patient
secondary_outcome.description: measured with the scale 7 (Overall quality of care provided to patients and family) from the Toolkit After-death bereaved family member interview (Teno 2001). The Toolkit will be administered to non-professional caregivers 2-4 months after the patient's death

secondary_outcome.measure: Quality of communication between General Practitioner and hospice
secondary_outcome.time_frame: an expected average of 2 months after the patient's death

arm_group.description: The LCP Program is continuous quality improvement program of end-of-life care implemented in hospice

intervention.description: The LCP Program is continuous quality improvement program of end-of-life care implemented in hospice

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- All patients deceased in the hospice during the evaluation period
- Approval of ethics committee
Exclusion Criteria:
- Prior use of LCP in the hospice
- Deceased was a relative of a hospice member of staff
